issue.explanation:
Lint can be extended with "custom checks": additional checks implemented by developers and libraries to for example enforce specific API usages required by a library or a company coding style guideline.
The Lint APIs are not yet stable, so these checks may either cause a performance degradation, or stop working, or provide wrong results.
This warning flags custom lint checks that are found to be using obsolete APIs and will need to be updated to run in the current lint environment.
It may also flag issues found to be using a **newer** version of the API, meaning that you need to use a newer version of lint (or Android Studio or Gradle plugin etc) to work with these checks.

issue.message: Consider using `apply()` instead; `commit` writes its data to persistent storage immediately, whereas `apply` will handle it in the background
issue.explanation: Consider using `apply()` instead of `commit` on shared preferences. Whereas `commit` blocks and writes its data to persistent storage immediately, `apply` will handle it in the background.

issue.message: Consider using `apply()` instead; `commit` writes its data to persistent storage immediately, whereas `apply` will handle it in the background
issue.explanation: Consider using `apply()` instead of `commit` on shared preferences. Whereas `commit` blocks and writes its data to persistent storage immediately, `apply` will handle it in the background.

issue.message: Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `String.format(Locale, ...)` instead
issue.summary: Implied default locale in case conversion
issue.explanation:
Calling `String#toLowerCase()` or `#toUpperCase()` **without specifying an explicit locale** is a common source of bugs. The reason for that is that those methods will use the current locale on the user's device, and even though the code appears to work correctly when you are developing the app, it will fail in some locales. For example, in the Turkish locale, the uppercase replacement for `i` is **not** `I`.
If you want the methods to just perform ASCII replacement, for example to convert an enum name, call `String#toUpperCase(Locale.US)` instead. If you really want to use the current locale, call `String#toUpperCase(Locale.getDefault())` instead.

issue.summary: Implied default locale in case conversion
issue.explanation:
Calling `String#toLowerCase()` or `#toUpperCase()` **without specifying an explicit locale** is a common source of bugs. The reason for that is that those methods will use the current locale on the user's device, and even though the code appears to work correctly when you are developing the app, it will fail in some locales. For example, in the Turkish locale, the uppercase replacement for `i` is **not** `I`.
If you want the methods to just perform ASCII replacement, for example to convert an enum name, call `String#toUpperCase(Locale.US)` instead. If you really want to use the current locale, call `String#toUpperCase(Locale.getDefault())` instead.
issue.errorLine1: c.drawText(String.format("%.1f fps", fps), width * 0.02f, height * 0.25f, fpsPaint);

issue.message: Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `String.format(Locale, ...)` instead
issue.summary: Implied default locale in case conversion
issue.explanation:
Calling `String#toLowerCase()` or `#toUpperCase()` **without specifying an explicit locale** is a common source of bugs. The reason for that is that those methods will use the current locale on the user's device, and even though the code appears to work correctly when you are developing the app, it will fail in some locales. For example, in the Turkish locale, the uppercase replacement for `i` is **not** `I`.
If you want the methods to just perform ASCII replacement, for example to convert an enum name, call `String#toUpperCase(Locale.US)` instead. If you really want to use the current locale, call `String#toUpperCase(Locale.getDefault())` instead.

issue.message: Field requires API level 8 (current min is 4): `android.view.HapticFeedbackConstants#KEYBOARD_TAP`
issue.summary: Using inlined constants on older versions
issue.explanation:
This check scans through all the Android API field references in the application and flags certain constants, such as static final integers and Strings, which were introduced in later versions. These will actually be copied into the class files rather than being referenced, which means that the value is available even when running on older devices. In some cases that's fine, and in other cases it can result in a runtime crash or incorrect behavior. It depends on the context, so consider the code carefully and decide whether it's safe and can be suppressed or whether the code needs to be guarded.
If you really want to use this API and don't need to support older devices just set the `minSdkVersion` in your `build.gradle` or `AndroidManifest.xml` files.
If your code is **deliberately** accessing newer APIs, and you have ensured (e.g. with conditional execution) that this code will only ever be called on a supported platform, then you can annotate your class or method with the `@TargetApi` annotation specifying the local minimum SDK to apply, such as `@TargetApi(11)`, such that this check considers 11 rather than your manifest file's minimum SDK as the required API level.

issue.message: The locale folder "`id`" should be called "`in`" instead; see the `java.util.Locale` documentation
issue.explanation:
From the `java.util.Locale` documentation: "Note that Java uses several deprecated two-letter codes. The Hebrew ("he") language code is rewritten as "iw", Indonesian ("id") as "in", and Yiddish ("yi") as "ji". This rewriting happens even if you construct your own Locale object, not just for instances returned by the various lookup methods.
Because of this, if you add your localized resources in for example `values-he` they will not be used, since the system will look for `values-iw` instead.
To work around this, place your resources in a `values` folder using the deprecated language code instead.

issue.message: Not targeting the latest versions of Android; compatibility modes apply. Consider testing and updating this version. Consult the android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES javadoc for details.
issue.summary: Target SDK attribute is not targeting latest version
issue.explanation:
When your application runs on a version of Android that is more recent than your `targetSdkVersion` specifies that it has been tested with, various compatibility modes kick in. This ensures that your application continues to work, but it may look out of place. For example, if the `targetSdkVersion` is less than 14, your app may get an option button in the UI.
To fix this issue, set the `targetSdkVersion` to the highest available value. Then test your app to make sure everything works correctly. You may want to consult the compatibility notes to see what changes apply to each version you are adding support for: https://developer.android.com/reference/android/os/Build.VERSION_CODES.html as well as follow this guide: https://developer.android.com/distribute/best-practices/develop/target-sdk.html

issue.message: Attribute `installLocation` is only used in API level 8 and higher (current min is 4)
issue.explanation:
This check finds attributes set in XML files that were introduced in a version newer than the oldest version targeted by your application (with the `minSdkVersion` attribute).
This is not an error; the application will simply ignore the attribute. However, if the attribute is important to the appearance or functionality of your application, you should consider finding an alternative way to achieve the same result with only available attributes, and then you can optionally create a copy of the layout in a layout-vNN folder which will be used on API NN or higher where you can take advantage of the newer attribute.
Note: This check does not only apply to attributes. For example, some tags can be unused too, such as the new `<tag>` element in layouts introduced in API 21.

issue.message: Attribute `required` is only used in API level 5 and higher (current min is 4)

issue.message: A newer version of com.android.tools:desugar_jdk_libs than 1.1.5 is available: 1.2.0
issue.explanation: This detector looks for usages of libraries where the version you are using is not the current stable release. Using older versions is fine, and there are cases where you deliberately want to stick with an older version. However, you may simply not be aware that a more recent version is available, and that is what this lint check helps find.

issue.message: Expecting `android:screenOrientation="unspecified"` or `"fullSensor"` for this activity so the user can use the application in any orientation and provide a great experience on Chrome OS devices
issue.explanation: The `<activity>` element should not be locked to any orientation so that users can take advantage of the multi-window environments and larger screens available on Android. To fix the issue, consider declaring the corresponding activity element with `screenOrientation="unspecified"`or `"fullSensor"` attribute.

issue.message: Repeated word "teker" in message: possible typo
issue.explanation: This check looks through the string definitions, and if it finds any words that look like likely misspellings, they are flagged.
issue.errorLine1:
<string name="table1_rules">1. Masa Kuralı:
- Üstteki ya da alt yollardaki açık mavi renkli yuvarlakları vurarak puan katsayınızı arttırın. Kazandığınız puanlar bu katsayı ile çarpılır. Topu soldaki rampadan geçirmek de bu katsayıyı arttırır.
- Başlangıçta sağ ve sol boşluklarda tek kullanımlık top kurtarıcılar bulunur. Sağ veya soldaki hedef gruplarının tamamını vurarak bunları tekrar getirin.
- Herhangi bir hedef grubunun tamamını vurmak merkezdeki ışıkların teker teker yanmasını sağlar. Büyük beyaz ışık yandığında topu soldaki rampadan geçirerek çoklu top modunu etkinleştirin.</string>

issue.message: The resource string "app_name" is marked as translatable="false", but is translated to "fr" (French) here
issue.explanation:
Strings can be marked with `translatable=false` to indicate that they are not intended to be translated, but are present in the resource file for other purposes (for example for non-display strings that should vary by some other configuration qualifier such as screen size or API level).
There are cases where translators accidentally translate these strings anyway, and lint will flag these occurrences with this lint check.

issue.message: Formatting %d followed by words ("Score"): This should probably be a plural rather than a string
issue.explanation:
This lint check looks for potential errors in internationalization where you have translated a message which involves a quantity and it looks like other parts of the string may need grammatical changes.
For example, rather than something like this: ```xml <string name="try_again">Try again in %d seconds.</string> ``` you should be using a plural: ```xml <plurals name="try_again"> <item quantity="one">Try again in %d second</item> <item quantity="other">Try again in %d seconds</item> </plurals> ``` This will ensure that in other languages the right set of translations are provided for the different quantity classes.
(This check depends on some heuristics, so it may not accurately determine whether a string really should be a quantity. You can use tools:ignore to filter out false positives.

issue.message: Formatting %d followed by words ("Locked"): This should probably be a plural rather than a string
issue.explanation:

(This check depends on some heuristics, so it may not accurately determine whether a string really should be a quantity. You can use tools:ignore to filter out false positives.

issue.message: Do not place Android context classes in static fields; this is a memory leak
issue.explanation:
A static field will leak contexts.
Non-static inner classes have an implicit reference to their outer class. If that outer class is for example a `Fragment` or `Activity`, then this reference means that the long-running handler/loader/task will hold a reference to the activity which prevents it from getting garbage collected.
Similarly, direct field references to activities and fragments from these longer running instances can cause leaks.
ViewModel classes should never point to Views or non-application Contexts.

issue.message: Replace "-" with an "en dash" character (–, –) ?
issue.summary: Hyphen can be replaced with dash
issue.explanation: The "n dash" (\u2013, –) and the "m dash" (\u2014, —) characters are used for ranges (n dash) and breaks (m dash). Using these instead of plain hyphens can make text easier to read and your application will look more polished.
issue.errorLine1:
<string name="about_text">Vector Pinball 1.10.0
© 2010-2022 Brian NENNINGER

Komentoj kaj erar-raportoj:
bnenning@gmail.com

Frapetu la ekranon por komenci novan ludon, katapulti novan globon (se ne sur la tablo) kaj movi la puŝilojn. Frapetu la kampon de poentoj por paŭzigi ludon.

[TABLE_RULES]

Frapetu la butonon “agordoj” aŭ la menu‑butonon por malfermi elekteblojn:
 • sono: (mal)aktivigas sonefektojn;
 • fona muziko: mal(aktivigas) fonan muzikon;
 • sendependaj puŝiloj: kiam malaktiva, ĉiu frapeto aktivigas ambaŭ pusilojn; kiam akvita, vi devas frapeti maldekstran flankon de la ekrano por aktivigi la maldekstran puŝilon, kaj dekstran por dekstran puŝilon;
 • pligrandigi ludkampon: kiam aktiva, la vido estos pligrandigita kaj fokusita sur la globo;
 • OpenGL‑bildigado: uzas OpenGL por bildigi grafikon, povas pliigi rendimenton en iuj aparatoj, sed malpliigi ĝin en aliaj;
 • montri kadrojn sekunde (FPS): montras kadrojn bildigitajn dum sekundo ĉe la maldekstra supra angulo.

La ludo Vector Pinball estas malfermkoda, la kodo troviĝas ĉe https://github.com/dozingcat/Vector-Pinball

Dankojn al Mario de www.badlogicgames.com por plibonigoj al la kodo kaj por la biblioteko libgdx.

Sono, muziko kaj sonkodo danke al pdx
Twittering Machine
https://www.twittering.com</string>

Stuknij w ekran, aby rozpocząć nową grę, wystrzelić piłkę (jeżeli nie jest obecna) i poruszać łapkami. Stuknij w pole punktów, aby spauzować grę.

[TABLE_RULES]

Stuknij w przycisk menu lub „ustawienia”, aby skonfigurować następujące opcje:
 • dźwięk: włącza i wyłącza efekty dźwiękowe
 • muzyka: włącza i wyłącza muzykę w tle
 • niezależne łapki: odznacz, aby każde stuknięcie w ekran poruszało obiema łapkami; zaznacz, aby stuknięcie w lewą część ekranu poruszało lewą łapką i stuknięcie w prawą część ekranu poruszało prawą
 • przybliż pole gry: zaznacz, aby pole gry zostało przybliżone do lokalizacji piłki
 • renderowanie OpenGL: używa OpenGL do rysowania grafiki, zwiększa wydajność na niektórych urządzeniach, ale zmniejsza na innych
 • wyświetl FPS: gdy zaznaczone, w lewym górnym rogu jest wyświetlana liczba rysowanych klatek na sekundę.

Gra Vector Pinball jest otwartoźródłowa, kod źródłowy dostępny jest na https://github.com/dozingcat/Vector-Pinball

Podziękowania dla Mario z www.badlogicgames.com za kod i ulepszenia w libgdx.

Dźwięk, muzyka i kod audio: pdx
Twittering Machine
https://www.twittering.com</string>

Yeni bir oyun başlatmak için ekrana dokunun, eğer oyunda zaten bir top yoksa yeni bir top fırlatın ve kolları hareket ettirin. Oyunu durdurmak için puana dokunun.

[TABLE_RULES]

Tercihler bölümünden aşağıdaki ayarları değiştirebilirsiniz:
- Ses: Ses efektini açar kapatır
- Arka Plan Müziği: Arka plan müziğini açar kapatır
- Ayrık Kollar: Seçilmemişken tüm kollar aynı anda hareket eder. Seçilmişken sağdaki kollar için sağda, soldaki kollar için solda bir yere dokunmanız gerekir.
- Yakınlaştır: Seçilmişken görüntü topa yakın haldedir.
- OpenGL Kullan: Seçilmişken grafikler için OpenGL kullanır. Bu genelde performans ve grafik kalitesi için en iyi seçenektir ama bazı cihazlar için bunun seçilmemesi daha iyi olabilir.
- FPS Göster: Seçilmişken ekranın sol üst köşesinde saniyede kaç kare görüntülendiğini yazar.

Vector Pinball açık kaynak kodlu bir yazılımdır, kodlar https://github.com/dozingcat/Vector-Pinball adresinden görüntülenebilir.

Kod iyileştirmeleri ve libgdx için www.badlogicgames.com adresinden Mario'ya teşekkürler.

ses, müzik & ses kodu, pdx tarafından
Twittering Machine
https://www.twittering.com</string>

bnenning@gmail.com

Touchez l\écran pour commencer une nouvelle partie, lancer la première bille et activer les flippers. Toucher la zone du score met en pause le jeu..

[TABLE_RULES]

Sélectionner le bouton ou le menu préférence permet de modifier les options suivantes:
- Son: Activer ou désactiver les effets sonores.
- Musique de fond : Activer et désactiver la musique de fond.
- Retour haptique : Vibration en cas de chocs et autres événements du jeu.
Flippers indépendants : Une fois désactivé, n'importe quel touché active les deux flippers. Activé, il faut toucher le bord gauche ou le bord droit pour activer tel ou tel flipper.
- Zoom: Activé, la vue est zoomée sur l'emplacement de la bille pendant le jeu.
- Rendu OpenGL : Utilise OpenGL pour les graphismes. Cela permet généralement d'obtenir la meilleure combinaison de qualité graphique et de performances, mais certains appareils fonctionnent mieux sans.
- Montrer les FPS: Activé, montre les images par seconde en haut à gauche.

Vector Pinball est open-source; Le code est ici https://github.com/dozingcat/Vector-Pinball

Merci à Mario de www.badlogicgames.com pour les améliorations du code et libgdx.

La musique et les sons , le code des sons, par pdx
Twittering Machine
https://www.twittering.com</string>

Tekan layar untuk memulai permainan baru, luncurkan bola jika tidak ada yang dimainkan, dan aktifkan palangnya. Tekan area skor untuk menjeda permainan.

[TABLE_RULES]

Memilih tombol Preferensi atau item menu memperbolehkan Anda untuk mengubah pengaturan sebagai berikut:
- Suara: Menyalakan dan mematikan efek suara.
- Musik Latar Belakang: Menyalakan dan mematikan musik latar belakang.
- Umpan Balik Haptik: Bergetar saat bola menyentuh bumper dan alat dalam permainan lainnya.
Palang Tersendiri: Ketika tidak dicentang, tekanan apa pun akan mengaktifkan kedua palang. Ketika dicentang Anda harus menekan sisi kiri layar untuk palang kiri dan sisi kanan untuk palang kanan.
- Perbesar: Ketika dicentang, layar akan diperbesar pada lokasi bola saat bermain
- OpenGL Rendering: Menggunakan OpenGL untuk menggambar grafik. Ini biasanya memberikan kombinasi terbaik untuk kualitas grafik dan performa, tapi beberapa perangkat akan lebih baik jika ini dimatikan.
- Perlihatkan FPS: When checked, shows frames drawn per second in the upper left. Ketika dicentang, perlihatkan bingkai tergambar per detik di kanan atas.

Vector Pinball merupakan aplikasi sumber terbuka; kodenya ada di https://github.com/dozingcat/Vector-Pinball

Terima kasih kepada Mario di www.badlogicgames.com untuk perbaikan kode dan libgdx.

suara, musik, & kode audio, oleh pdx
Twittering Machine
https://www.twittering.com</string>

- Musik Latar Belakang: Menyalakan dan mematikan musik latar belakang.
- Umpan Balik Haptik: Bergetar saat bola menyentuh bumper dan alat dalam permainan lainnya.
Palang Tersendiri: Ketika tidak dicentang, tekanan apa pun akan mengaktifkan kedua palang. Ketika dicentang Anda harus menekan sisi kiri layar untuk palang kiri dan sisi kanan untuk palang kanan.
- Perbesar: Ketika dicentang, layar akan diperbesar pada lokasi bola saat bermain
- OpenGL Rendering: Menggunakan OpenGL untuk menggambar grafik. Ini biasanya memberikan kombinasi terbaik untuk kualitas grafik dan performa, tapi beberapa perangkat akan lebih baik jika ini dimatikan.
- Perlihatkan FPS: When checked, shows frames drawn per second in the upper left. Ketika dicentang, perlihatkan bingkai tergambar per detik di kanan atas.

Vector Pinball merupakan aplikasi sumber terbuka; kodenya ada di https://github.com/dozingcat/Vector-Pinball

Terima kasih kepada Mario di www.badlogicgames.com untuk perbaikan kode dan libgdx.

suara, musik, & kode audio, oleh pdx
Twittering Machine
https://www.twittering.com</string>

issue.message: Replace "-" with an "en dash" character (–, –) ?
issue.summary: Hyphen can be replaced with dash
issue.explanation: The "n dash" (\u2013, –) and the "m dash" (\u2014, —) characters are used for ranges (n dash) and breaks (m dash). Using these instead of plain hyphens can make text easier to read and your application will look more polished.
issue.errorLine1:
<string name="about_text">Vector Pinball 1.10.0
© 2010-2022 Brian Nenninger

Comments en bug-opmerkingen:
bnenning@gmail.com

Raak de scherm aan om een nieuwe speel te beginnen, een bal lanceren als een is niet in het spel, en ook de flippers te activeren. Raak het scoregebied aan om het spel te pauzeren.

[TABLE_RULES]

Door de knop Voorkeuren of het menu-item te selecteren, kunt u de volgende instellingen wijzigen:
- Geluid: Schakelt geluidseffecten in en uit.
- Achtergrondmuziek: Schakelt achtergrondmuziek in en uit.
- Haptische Feedback: trilt bij bumperhits en andere game-evenementen.
Onafhankelijke Flippers: indien niet aangevinkt, activeert elke aanraking beide flippers. Als dit is aangevinkt, moet u de linkerkant van het scherm aanraken voor de linkerflipper en de rechterkant voor de rechterflipper.
- De Speelveld Inzoomen: Als deze optie is aangevinkt, wordt tijdens het spelen ingezoomd op de locatie van de bal.
- OpenGL-Rendering: Gebruikt OpenGL om afbeeldingen te tekenen. Dit biedt meestal de beste combinatie van grafische kwaliteit en prestaties, maar sommige apparaten doen het misschien beter als het is uitgeschakeld.
- Toon FPS: indien aangevinkt, toont frames per seconde getekend in de linkerbovenhoek.

Vector Pinball is open source; de code staat op https://github.com/dozingcat/Vector-Pinball

Met dank aan Mario op www.badlogicgames.com voor codeverbeteringen en libgdx.

geluid, muziek & audiocode, door pdx
Twittering Machine
https://www.twittering.com</string>

issue.message: Replace "-" with an "en dash" character (–, –) ?
issue.summary: Hyphen can be replaced with dash
issue.explanation: The "n dash" (\u2013, –) and the "m dash" (\u2014, —) characters are used for ranges (n dash) and breaks (m dash). Using these instead of plain hyphens can make text easier to read and your application will look more polished.
issue.errorLine1:
<string name="about_text">Vector Pinball 1.10.0
© 2010-2022 Brian Nenninger

Comments and bug reports:
bnenning@gmail.com

Touch the screen to start a new game, launch a ball if one is not in play, and activate the flippers. Touch the score area to pause the game.

[TABLE_RULES]

The Preferences menu item allows you to change the following settings:
- Sound: Enables and disables sound effects.
- Background Music: Enables and disabled background music.
- Haptic Feedback: Vibrates on bumper hits and other game events.
- Independent Flippers: When unchecked, any touch activates both flippers. When checked, you must touch the left side of the screen for the left flipper, and the right side for the right flipper.
- Zoom: When checked, the view will zoom in on the ball's location during play.
- OpenGL Rendering: Uses OpenGL to draw graphics. This usually provides the best combination of graphics quality and performance, but some devices may do better with it disabled.
- Show FPS: When checked, shows frames drawn per second in the upper left.

Vector Pinball is open source; the code is at
https://github.com/dozingcat/Vector-Pinball

Thanks to Mario Zechner for code improvements and libgdx.

sound, music, & audio code, by pdx
Twittering Machine
https://www.twittering.com</string>

issue.message: Launcher icons should not fill every pixel of their square region; see the design guide for details
issue.summary: The launcher icon shape should use a distinct silhouette
issue.explanation:
According to the Android Design Guide (https://material.io/design/iconography/) your launcher icons should "use a distinct silhouette", a "three-dimensional, front view, with a slight perspective as if viewed from above, so that users perceive some depth."
The unique silhouette implies that your launcher icon should not be a filled square.

issue.message: Custom view `CanvasFieldView` overrides `onTouchEvent` but not `performClick`
issue.explanation: If a `View` that overrides `onTouchEvent` or uses an `OnTouchListener` does not also implement `performClick` and call it when clicks are detected, the `View` may not handle accessibility actions properly. Logic handling the click actions should ideally be placed in `View#performClick` as some accessibility services invoke `performClick` when a click action should occur.

issue.message: Custom view `GLFieldView` overrides `onTouchEvent` but not `performClick`
issue.explanation: If a `View` that overrides `onTouchEvent` or uses an `OnTouchListener` does not also implement `performClick` and call it when clicks are detected, the `View` may not handle accessibility actions properly. Logic handling the click actions should ideally be placed in `View#performClick` as some accessibility services invoke `performClick` when a click action should occur.

issue.message: Should use `registerListener(SensorEventListener, Sensor, int, int)` instead of `registerListener(SensorEventListener, Sensor, int)`
issue.summary: Events should be kept temporarily before being delivered
issue.explanation: The method registerListener(SensorEventListener, Sensor, int, int) allows eventsto be stored in the hardware queue (FIFO) up to maxReportLatencyUs. Setting maxReportLatencyUs to a positive value allows to reduce the number of interrupts the AP receives, hence reducing power consumption.

issue.message: Should use `registerListener(SensorEventListener, Sensor, int, int)` instead of `registerListener(SensorEventListener, Sensor, int)`
issue.summary: Events should be kept temporarily before being delivered
issue.explanation: The method registerListener(SensorEventListener, Sensor, int, int) allows eventsto be stored in the hardware queue (FIFO) up to maxReportLatencyUs. Setting maxReportLatencyUs to a positive value allows to reduce the number of interrupts the AP receives, hence reducing power consumption.
